faq.heading: faq heading
faq.text:
This is always the 1st question asked. Actually you'd be amazed how many people living on the streets have a smart phone as people often donate their old phones to charities and shelters, and they all know where to find wifi
Public libraries and shelters are normally spaces with computers and wifi. They are warm and comfortable so people without a home often spend time there
It’s also possible to print our maps and hand them out on the streets or at a shelter as an invaluable guide to where to go to meet all your basic needs
Of course you could always use the map to arrange an ‘old phone’ collection and give-away yourself, and also arrange a with some local cafes to allow people who are homeless to drop them off for charging when needed
